segment.source: When using the XML files MigDocs.xml, MigApp.xml, and MigUser.xml, you can use environment variables to identify folders that may be different on different computers.
segment.target: When using the XML files MigDocs.xml, MigApp.xml, and MigUser.xml, you can use environment variables to identify folders that may be different on different computers.

segment.source: Constant special item ID list (CSIDL) values provide a way to identify folders that applications use frequently but may not have the same name or location on any given computer.
segment.target: Constant special item ID list (CSIDL) values provide a way to identify folders that applications use frequently but may not have the same name or location on any given computer.

segment.source: For example, the documents folder may be C:UsersUsernameMy Documents on one computer and C:Documents and Settings on another.
segment.target: For example, the documents folder may be C:UsersUsernameMy Documents on one computer and C:Documents and Settings on another.

segment.source: You can use the asterisk () wildcard character in MigUser.xml, MigApp.xml and MigDoc.xml files.
segment.target: You can use the asterisk () wildcard character in MigUser.xml, MigApp.xml and MigDoc.xml files.

segment.source: However, you cannot use the asterisk () wildcard characters in the Config.xml file.
segment.target: However, you cannot use the asterisk () wildcard characters in the Config.xml file.

segment.source: Variables that are processed for the operating system and in the context of each user
segment.target: Variables that are processed for the operating system and in the context of each user

segment.source: Variables that are recognized only in the user context
segment.target: Variables that are recognized only in the user context

segment.source: Variables that are processed for the operating system and in the context of each user
segment.target: Variables that are processed for the operating system and in the context of each user

segment.source: You can use these variables within sections in the .xml files with , , and .
segment.target: You can use these variables within sections in the .xml files with , , and .

segment.source: Refers to the C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files folder on 64-bit systems.
segment.target: Refers to the C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files folder on 64-bit systems.

segment.source: The file-system directory that contains administrative tools for all users of the computer.
segment.target: The file-system directory that contains administrative tools for all users of the computer.

segment.source: The file-system directory that corresponds to the non-localized Startup program group for all users.
segment.target: The file-system directory that corresponds to the non-localized Startup program group for all users.

segment.source: The file-system directory that contains application data for all users.
segment.target: The file-system directory that contains application data for all users.

segment.source: A typical path Windows is C:\ProgramData.
segment.target: A typical path Windows is C:\ProgramData.

segment.source: The file-system directory that contains files and folders that appear on the desktop for all users.
segment.target: The file-system directory that contains files and folders that appear on the desktop for all users.

segment.source: A typical Windows® XP path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Desktop.
segment.target: A typical Windows® XP path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Desktop.

segment.source: The file-system directory that contains documents that are common to all users.
segment.target: The file-system directory that contains documents that are common to all users.

segment.source: A typical path in Windows XP is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents.
segment.target: A typical path in Windows XP is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents.

segment.source: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for favorites common to all users.
segment.target: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for favorites common to all users.

segment.source: The file-system directory that serves as a repository for music files common to all users.
segment.target: The file-system directory that serves as a repository for music files common to all users.

segment.source: The file-system directory that serves as a repository for image files common to all users.
segment.target: The file-system directory that serves as a repository for image files common to all users.

segment.source: The file-system directory that contains the directories for the common program groups that appear on the Start menu for all users.
segment.target: The file-system directory that contains the directories for the common program groups that appear on the Start menu for all users.

segment.source: A typical path is C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs.
segment.target: A typical path is C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs.

segment.source: The file-system directory that contains the programs and folders which appear on the Start menu for all users.
segment.target: The file-system directory that contains the programs and folders which appear on the Start menu for all users.

segment.source: A typical path in Windows is C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu.
segment.target: A typical path in Windows is C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu.

segment.source: The file-system directory that contains the programs that appear in the Startup folder for all users.
segment.target: The file-system directory that contains the programs that appear in the Startup folder for all users.

segment.source: A typical path in Windows XP is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu\Programs\Startup.
segment.target: A typical path in Windows XP is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu\Programs\Startup.

segment.source: A typical path is C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup.
segment.target: A typical path is C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup.

segment.source: The file-system directory that contains the templates that are available to all users.
segment.target: The file-system directory that contains the templates that are available to all users.

segment.source: The file-system directory that serves as a repository for video files common to all users.
segment.target: The file-system directory that serves as a repository for video files common to all users.

segment.source: Refers to the Appdata folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the Appdata folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the local Appdata folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the local Appdata folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the Cookies folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the Cookies folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the Contacts folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the Contacts folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the Desktop folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the Desktop folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the Downloads folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the Downloads folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the Favorites folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the Favorites folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the History folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the History folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the Internet Cache folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the Internet Cache folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the Personal folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the Personal folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the My Documents folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the My Documents folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the My Pictures folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the My Pictures folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the My Music folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the My Music folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the My Videos folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the My Videos folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the Recent folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the Recent folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the Send To folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the Send To folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the Start Menu folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the Start Menu folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the Programs folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the Programs folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the Startup folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the Startup folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the Templates folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the Templates folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: Refers to the Quick Launch folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.
segment.target: Refers to the Quick Launch folder inside %DEFAULTUSERPROFILE%.

segment.source: The Program Files folder on 64-bit systems.
segment.target: The Program Files folder on 64-bit systems.

segment.source: A typical path is C:\Program Files(86).
segment.target: A typical path is C:\Program Files(86).

segment.source: A folder for components that are shared across applications on 64-bit systems.
segment.target: A folder for components that are shared across applications on 64-bit systems.

segment.source: A typical path is C:\Program Files(86)\Common.
segment.target: A typical path is C:\Program Files(86)\Common.

segment.source: A typical path is C:\Program Files.
segment.target: A typical path is C:\Program Files.

segment.source: A folder for components that are shared across applications.
segment.target: A folder for components that are shared across applications.

segment.source: A typical path is C:\Program Files\Common.
segment.target: A typical path is C:\Program Files\Common.

segment.source: The file-system directory that contains resource data.
segment.target: The file-system directory that contains resource data.

segment.source: The Windows directory or system root.
segment.target: The Windows directory or system root.

segment.source: This corresponds to the %WINDIR% or %SYSTEMROOT% environment variables.
segment.target: This corresponds to the %WINDIR% or %SYSTEMROOT% environment variables.

segment.source: Refers to the value in HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\ProfileList [DefaultUserProfile].
segment.target: Refers to the value in HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\ProfileList [DefaultUserProfile].

segment.source: Refers to the value in HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\ProfileList [ProfilesDirectory].
segment.target: Refers to the value in HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\ProfileList [ProfilesDirectory].

segment.source: Refers to the C:\Program Files (x86) folder on 64-bit systems.
segment.target: Refers to the C:\Program Files (x86) folder on 64-bit systems.

segment.source: Refers to the value in HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\ProfileList\S-1-5-18 [ProfileImagePath].
segment.target: Refers to the value in HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\ProfileList\S-1-5-18 [ProfileImagePath].

segment.source: Refers to the root of the system drive.
segment.target: Refers to the root of the system drive.

segment.source: Refers to the Windows folder located on the system drive.
segment.target: Refers to the Windows folder located on the system drive.

segment.source: Variables that are recognized only in the user context
segment.target: Variables that are recognized only in the user context

segment.source: You can use these variables in the .xml files within sections with and .
segment.target: You can use these variables in the .xml files within sections with and .

segment.source: The file-system directory that is used to store administrative tools for an individual user.
segment.target: The file-system directory that is used to store administrative tools for an individual user.

segment.source: The Microsoft® Management Console (MMC) saves customized consoles to this directory, which roams with the user profile.
segment.target: The Microsoft® Management Console (MMC) saves customized consoles to this directory, which roams with the user profile.

segment.source: The file-system directory that corresponds to the user's non-localized Startup program group.
segment.target: The file-system directory that corresponds to the user's non-localized Startup program group.

segment.source: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for application-specific data.
segment.target: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for application-specific data.

segment.source: A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Application Data or C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming.
segment.target: A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Application Data or C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming.

segment.source: The virtual folder that contains the objects in the user's Recycle Bin.
segment.target: The virtual folder that contains the objects in the user's Recycle Bin.

segment.source: The file-system directory acting as a staging area for files waiting to be written to CD.
segment.target: The file-system directory acting as a staging area for files waiting to be written to CD.

segment.source: The virtual folder representing Network Connections that contains network and dial-up connections.
segment.target: The virtual folder representing Network Connections that contains network and dial-up connections.

segment.source: This refers to the Contacts folder in %CSIDL_PROFILE%.
segment.target: This refers to the Contacts folder in %CSIDL_PROFILE%.

segment.source: The virtual folder that contains icons for the Control Panel items.
segment.target: The virtual folder that contains icons for the Control Panel items.

segment.source: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for Internet cookies.
segment.target: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for Internet cookies.

segment.source: The virtual folder representing the Windows desktop.
segment.target: The virtual folder representing the Windows desktop.

segment.source: The file-system directory used to physically store file objects on the desktop, which should not be confused with the desktop folder itself.
segment.target: The file-system directory used to physically store file objects on the desktop, which should not be confused with the desktop folder itself.

segment.source: The virtual folder representing My Computer that contains everything on the local computer: storage devices, printers, and Control Panel.
segment.target: The virtual folder representing My Computer that contains everything on the local computer: storage devices, printers, and Control Panel.

segment.source: The folder may also contain mapped network drives.
segment.target: The folder may also contain mapped network drives.

segment.source: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for the user's favorites.
segment.target: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for the user's favorites.

segment.source: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for Internet history items.
segment.target: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for Internet history items.

segment.source: A virtual folder for Internet Explorer.
segment.target: A virtual folder for Internet Explorer.

segment.source: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for temporary Internet files.
segment.target: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for temporary Internet files.

segment.source: A typical path is C:\Users\username\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Windows\Temporary Internet Files
segment.target: A typical path is C:\Users\username\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Windows\Temporary Internet Files

segment.source: The file-system directory that serves as a data repository for local, non-roaming applications.
segment.target: The file-system directory that serves as a data repository for local, non-roaming applications.

segment.source: The virtual folder representing My Documents.A typical path is C:\Users\Username\Documents.
segment.target: The virtual folder representing My Documents.A typical path is C:\Users\Username\Documents.

segment.source: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for music files.
segment.target: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for music files.

segment.source: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for image files.
segment.target: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for image files.

segment.source: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for video files.
segment.target: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for video files.

segment.source: A file-system directory that contains the link objects that may exist in the My Network Places virtual folder.
segment.target: A file-system directory that contains the link objects that may exist in the My Network Places virtual folder.

segment.source: It is not the same as CSIDL_NETWORK, which represents the network namespace root.
segment.target: It is not the same as CSIDL_NETWORK, which represents the network namespace root.

segment.source: A virtual folder representing My Network Places, the root of the network namespace hierarchy.
segment.target: A virtual folder representing My Network Places, the root of the network namespace hierarchy.

segment.source: The virtual folder representing the My Documents desktop item.
segment.target: The virtual folder representing the My Documents desktop item.

segment.source: A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Documents.
segment.target: A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Documents.

segment.source: The virtual folder used to store play albums, typically C:\Users\username\My Music\Playlists.
segment.target: The virtual folder used to store play albums, typically C:\Users\username\My Music\Playlists.

segment.source: The virtual folder that contains installed printers.
segment.target: The virtual folder that contains installed printers.

segment.source: The file-system directory that contains the link objects that can exist in the Printers virtual folder.
segment.target: The file-system directory that contains the link objects that can exist in the Printers virtual folder.

segment.source: The file-system directory that contains the user's program groups, which are themselves file-system directories.
segment.target: The file-system directory that contains the user's program groups, which are themselves file-system directories.

segment.source: The file-system directory that contains shortcuts to the user's most recently used documents.
segment.target: The file-system directory that contains shortcuts to the user's most recently used documents.

segment.source: The file-system directory that contains Send To menu items.
segment.target: The file-system directory that contains Send To menu items.

segment.source: The file-system directory that contains Start menu items.
segment.target: The file-system directory that contains Start menu items.

segment.source: A typical path in Windows XP is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Start Menu.
segment.target: A typical path in Windows XP is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Start Menu.

segment.source: A typical path in Windows Vista, Windows 7, or Windows 8 is C:\Users\Username\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu.
segment.target: A typical path in Windows Vista, Windows 7, or Windows 8 is C:\Users\Username\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu.

segment.source: The file-system directory that corresponds to the user's Startup program group.
segment.target: The file-system directory that corresponds to the user's Startup program group.

segment.source: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for document templates.
segment.target: The file-system directory that serves as a common repository for document templates.

segment.source: Same as the standard environment variable.
segment.target: Same as the standard environment variable.

segment.source: The temporary folder on the computer.
segment.target: The temporary folder on the computer.

segment.source: The temporary folder on the computer.
segment.target: The temporary folder on the computer.

segment.source: Represents the current user-account security identifier (SID).
segment.target: Represents the current user-account security identifier (SID).
